newsitem.title: FINLAND: Benefon rallies more amid GSM talk.
newsitem.headline: Benefon rallies more amid GSM talk.

text.p: Shares in Finnish mobile phone maker Benefon Oy extended gains on Wednesday following rumours on Tuesday that it would soon launch its first GSM phone, but some brokers said the rise was overdone.
At 1145/0945 GMT, Benefon traded at 96.00 markka, up 9.00 markka or more than 10 percent, after hitting 98.00 markka. Trade was a lively 4.0 million markka.
"I think the rise is overdone since Benefon's GSM (Global System for Mobile Communications) product is unlikely to be a success as it is coming too late anyway," one broker said. @
No one at Benefon, which has repeatedly said its GSM launch has been delayed, was immediately available to comment.
The company's Benefon's full 1996 report is due on Friday. On January 31 it reported a preliminary 32 million markka profit after financial items, down from 74 million.
